page.title: 12INDUSTRY.HOLT. WORCS
page.content: In 1985 bows and arrows are still being sold by Severn Products from their retail section in the Boreley lanes east of the river not far from Holt Farm caravan site. The business started in 1958, originally making bows and arrows; mass produced bows are now imported from Japan and Korea. Aluminium shafts for arrows are imported from the U.S.A. Bows and arrows are assembled at Astley and sold from Boreley. Much selling is by mail-order to places in Britain and abroad. One bow and one arrow are Severn Products' designs. Fibre glass and plastic now join traditional wood and feathers in manufacture. The only use for these bows and arrows is for target archery, an increasingly popular sport. Nine local employees.
